clinical_study.brief_title: The Relationship Between NK Cell and Graves' Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Mechanism of NK Cell Disfunction in Graves' Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Graves' disease (GD) is one of organ specific autoimmune diseases, the pathogenesis is not elucidated.Natural Killer (Natural Killer, NK) cells is a kind of important immune regulator, several abnormalities of NK cell function and number in GD patients have been described in the investigators' previous study. It is remain unclear whether the NK cell disfunction is a consequence of GD.Based on the investigators' previous study, the investigators plan to monitor NK cell function in participants in the whole course of disease, analyze the association with relevant factors, such as thyroid function, immune state or treatment,to find out influences of thyroid hormones and thyroid receptor antibody affecting the function of NK cell. The investigators will reveal whether the disfunction of NK cell secondary to GD abnormal thyroid function and/or immune disorders, and realize the mechanics.

primary_outcome.measure: The number and function of NK cells changes of hyperthyroidism
primary_outcome.description: Flow cytometry used to measure the related changes of NK cells in hyperthyroidism

secondary_outcome.description: Detection of related cytokines by ELISA

arm_group.description: Before treatment and application of anti-thyroid drugs (methimazole) or radioactive iodine treatment
No thyroid related diseases and other immune diseases

study_pop.textblock: Adults aged of 18 to 75 years old
